result.execSummary:
The defendant Avashon Devon Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Decision And Order Denying Request To Modify Conditions Of Probation - defendant's request to modify the conditions of probation is denied - signed by the Court and filed.   Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. mag
Defendant's request to modify conditions of probation.
A Stipulation signed by all parties was filed today.  The Court indicated no hearing was needed if a stipulation was filed.
as to Restitution Amount, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months STRAIGHT TIME in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   No contact with Potowatomi Casino and Eric E.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges and supervision fees. 
          Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at  
          the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both. Defendant must make any future employer aware of this conviction.
     *   Restitution to be determined. Court will approve a stipulation if submitted.
     *   Court does not find the defendant eligible for expungement.

Defendant Avashon Devon Gray in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Avashon Devon Gray in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 09-09-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Avashon Devon Gray in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Eric E.; Alyssa B.; Amy R.; and Potawatomi Casino.

Defendant Avashon Devon Gray in court with attorney Scott r Winkler.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to Count 2. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.   DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (06-05-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Avashon Devon Gray
Current: 9010 W. North Avenue, Apt. 2, Milwaukee, WI 53226   (Effective: 06-05-2015)
Prior: 9030 West Bender Avenue #4, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
